column2: What is the difference between relative and absolute cell references in Excel?
column3: Relative cell references change when you copy the formula to another cell
column4: while absolute references (using $) remain fixed no matter where the formula is copied.
column15: Relative cell references change when you copy the formula to another cell  while absolute references (using $) remain fixed no matter where the formula is copied.

column2: How do you create a pivot table in Excel?
column7:
choose the data range, and drag the fields into Rows, Columns, Values, and Filters sections.
Excel Expert,What is VLOOKUP function used for?,The VLOOKUP function is used to look up a value in a table and return a corresponding value from a specified column, based on a matching key.
Excel Expert,What is the use of the IF function in Excel?,The IF function returns one value if a condition is TRUE and another value if the condition is FALSE. It's used for decision-making in formulas.
Excel Expert,How do you freeze panes in Excel?,To freeze panes, go to the View" tab
column9:
and choose the appropriate option to freeze rows or columns.
Excel Expert,What is the SUMIF function in Excel?,The SUMIF function adds the values in a range that meet a specified condition or criteria.
Excel Expert,What is conditional formatting in Excel?,Conditional formatting allows you to apply formatting to cells that meet specific conditions, such as changing cell color based on value.
Excel Expert,How do you use the CONCATENATE function?,The CONCATENATE function is used to join two or more strings of text into one cell, using `=CONCATENATE(text1, text2, ...)`.
Excel Expert,What is a named range in Excel?,A named range is a descriptive name given to a specific cell or range of cells for easier reference in formulas.
Excel Expert,How can you remove duplicates in Excel?,To remove duplicates, select the data, go to the Data" tab
column11:
and choose the columns to check for duplicates.
Excel Expert,What is the INDEX and MATCH function combination used for?,The INDEX and MATCH combination is used to look up values based on row and column positions, offering more flexibility than VLOOKUP.
Excel Expert,How do you create a drop-down list in Excel?,To create a drop-down list, select the cell, go to the Data" tab
column14:
and enter the values or reference a list range.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the COUNTIF function?,The COUNTIF function counts the number of cells in a range that meet a specified condition or criteria.
Excel Expert,What is the difference between COUNTIF and COUNTA?,COUNTIF counts the number of cells that meet a condition, while COUNTA counts the number of non-empty cells in a range.
Excel Expert,How do you use the TEXT function in Excel?,The TEXT function formats a number or date according to a specific format, e.g., `=TEXT(A1,dd/mm/yyyy")`.

column2: What is a macro in Excel?
column3: A macro in Excel is a series of recorded actions or commands that can be played back to automate repetitive tasks.
column15: A macro in Excel is a series of recorded actions or commands that can be played back to automate repetitive tasks.

column2: How do you create a chart in Excel?
column4: select the data you want to visualize
column6: and choose the desired chart type.
column15: To create a chart  select the data you want to visualize  go to the "Insert" tab  and choose the desired chart type.

column2: What is the difference between a line chart and a bar chart in Excel?
column3: A line chart displays trends over time
column4: while a bar chart shows comparisons between different categories or groups.
column15: A line chart displays trends over time  while a bar chart shows comparisons between different categories or groups.

column2: How do you protect a worksheet in Excel?
column6:
and set a password if desired.
Excel Expert,What is the function of the LEN function in Excel?,The LEN function returns the number of characters in a text string, including spaces.
Excel Expert,What does the NOW function do in Excel?,The NOW function returns the current date and time.
Excel Expert,How do you use the ROUND function in Excel?,The ROUND function rounds a number to a specified number of digits, e.g., `=ROUND(A1,2)` to round the value in cell A1 to two decimal places.
Excel Expert,What is a circular reference in Excel?,A circular reference occurs when a formula refers to its own cell, creating an endless loop that cannot resolve.
Excel Expert,What is the use of the PMT function in Excel?,The PMT function calculates the payment for a loan based on constant interest and loan period.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the AND function in Excel?,The AND function returns TRUE if all arguments are TRUE and FALSE if any of the arguments is FALSE, used to test multiple conditions at once.
Excel Expert,What is the OR function in Excel?,The OR function returns TRUE if any argument is TRUE, and FALSE if all arguments are FALSE, used for multiple conditional checks.
Excel Expert,How do you perform a conditional sum in Excel?,Use the SUMIF or SUMIFS function to sum values based on a specified condition or multiple conditions.
Excel Expert,What is the function of the FIND function in Excel?,The FIND function returns the starting position of a substring within another string, case-sensitive.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the SUBTOTAL function in Excel?,The SUBTOTAL function calculates the total of a specified range, and it can perform different operations such as SUM, AVERAGE, or COUNT, while ignoring hidden rows.
Excel Expert,How do you use data validation in Excel?,Data validation allows you to set rules for the values entered into a cell, such as restricting entries to a specific range of numbers or text length.
Excel Expert,What is an array formula in Excel?,An array formula performs multiple calculations on one or more items in an array and returns a single result or multiple results.
Excel Expert,How do you use the LEFT, RIGHT, and MID functions in Excel?,The LEFT function extracts a specified number of characters from the start of a string, the RIGHT function extracts from the end, and the MID function extracts characters from any position in the string.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the TRANSPOSE function in Excel?,The TRANSPOSE function switches the rows and columns of an array or range, effectively rotating the data.
Excel Expert,What is a pivot chart in Excel?,A pivot chart is a graphical representation of the data in a pivot table, allowing users to visualize trends and patterns.
Excel Expert,How do you group data in a pivot table?,To group data in a pivot table, right-click on the field in the Rows or Columns area and select Group
column7:
then specify the grouping options.
Excel Expert,How do you remove gridlines in Excel?,To remove gridlines, go to the View" tab
column8: uncheck the "Gridlines" box in the Show group.

column2: What is a dynamic named range in Excel?
column3: A dynamic named range automatically adjusts its size based on the data it contains
column4: usually created using formulas like OFFSET or COUNTA.
column15: A dynamic named range automatically adjusts its size based on the data it contains  usually created using formulas like OFFSET or COUNTA.

column2: How do you add a comment to a cell in Excel?
column6:
and type the comment text.
Excel Expert,What is a slicer in Excel?,A slicer is a visual filter that allows users to quickly filter data in a pivot table or pivot chart based on selected criteria.
Excel Expert,What is Power Query in Excel?,Power Query is a tool used for importing, transforming, and cleaning data before analysis, allowing users to connect to various data sources.
Excel Expert,How do you perform a text-to-column operation in Excel?,To split data into columns, select the data, go to the Data" tab
column8:
and follow the wizard to define the delimiter.
Excel Expert,What is the MATCH function in Excel?,The MATCH function searches for a specified value in a range and returns the relative position of that item.
Excel Expert,How do you calculate compound interest in Excel?,Use the formula `=P*(1+r/n)^(n*t)` where P is the principal, r is the interest rate, n is the number of periods, and t is the time.
Excel Expert,What is the HLOOKUP function used for in Excel?,HLOOKUP is used to look up a value in a table arranged horizontally, returning a value from a row in the table.
Excel Expert,What is the AVERAGEIF function in Excel?,The AVERAGEIF function calculates the average of cells that meet a specified condition or criteria.
Excel Expert,What is a 3D reference in Excel?,A 3D reference refers to a reference across multiple sheets in the same workbook, using a syntax like `=SUM(Sheet1:Sheet3!A1)`.
Excel Expert,How do you highlight cells based on certain criteria in Excel?,Use conditional formatting to highlight cells that meet specific criteria, such as values above or below a certain threshold.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the COUNTBLANK function in Excel?,The COUNTBLANK function counts the number of empty cells in a specified range.
Excel Expert,How do you calculate the depreciation of an asset in Excel?,Use the `=SLN()` function for straight-line depreciation or `=DDB()` for double-declining balance depreciation.
Excel Expert,What is a structured reference in Excel?,A structured reference is a way to refer to columns or ranges by their names, often used in tables for easier understanding and maintenance.
Excel Expert,What is the purpose of the ISERROR function in Excel?,The ISERROR function checks if a value results in an error and returns TRUE if it does, or FALSE if it does not.
